w:r.w:t: TITLE: What We Use at School

The teacher will teach school vocabulary words by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases: classroom, books, desks, pencils, scissors, globe, map, I see ___ in the classroom, blackboard, backpack, chair, clock,
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce the words for school
Spell and pronounce common associated words
Use sets of words in complete sentences
Word List: classroom, books, desks, pencils, scissors, globe, map, blackboard, backpack, clock, chair
This slide will always be the Naativ-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: “Today, we are going to be learning about school works!
Listen to your teacher read the poem.
Point to your eyes when you hear,
Read the poem to the student. Point to your eyes when you say the word,
Read it a second time and have the child join in by pointing to his or her eyes.
Encourage the child to say it as well.
and have the child spell it too.
I see books in the classroom
Circle the books in the classroom
by writing the word on the scree
as you underline the phrase under the picture of the books. Point to your eyes when you say the word,

Ask, “Where are the books?” and circle the picture of the classroom. Make a circle with your finger and say, “Circle the books.” Encourage the student to find the books in the picture of the classroom and circle them.
while saying these phrases. Have the student repeat.
on the screen, clear the screen and have the child write it as well.

Write the missing letters for each word.
Encourage the student to write the missing letters for each vocabulary word. Do the first one to prompt the student if needed.

Review the names of the school words
Circle one picture at a time. Ask the child, “What is this?” Correct and prompt the child as needed.
Find new school words in the picture (books, desks, map, globe, pencil)
Ask the child, “What do you see?” Encourage the child to answer in complete sentences (
I see a globe, I see a map, I see desks, I see books, I see pencils)
I see a backpack in the classroom
Circle the backpack in the classroom
by writing the word on the screen
as you underline the phrase under the picture of the backpack. Point to your eyes when you say the word,

Draw a picture of each word
Start drawing a picture of a chair in the first square. Clear the screen and have the child draw a picture in each box. Have the child read each word.
Find school words in the picture
Ask, “What do you see in the classroom?” Encourage the child to answer in complete sentences,
I see a map, I see a clock, I see desks, I see books, I see pencils, I see chairs.
Draw a picture of your classroom.
Start to draw a picture of a classroom. Try to get the student to draw their own classroom.
Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide
Students should have a blank slide to draw a picture of
classroom, books, desks, pencils, scissors, globe, map, blackboard, backpack, clock, chair
classroom, books, desks, pencils, scissors, globe, map, blackboard, backpack, clock, chair)
Teacher will prompt student to draw a picture to represent
classroom, books, desks, pencils, scissors, globe, map, blackboard, backpack, clock, chair
through pictures. One prompt at a time.
Teacher will write words from the lesson (
classroom, books, desks, pencils, scissors, globe, map, blackboard, backpack, clock, chair)
Word Wall Vocabulary Builder Activity – Slide 22
Students will read and spell their new words:
classroom, books, desks, pencils, scissors, globe, map, blackboard, backpack, clock, chair
Teacher will give feedback on the spelling and pronunciation of the new words.
